channel.title: Irrigation Detection in Satellite Imagery on Self-supervised Learning for Irrigation Detection
channel.description: Recent content in Irrigation Detection in Satellite Imagery on Self-supervised Learning for Irrigation Detection

item.title: Baseline Models
item.description: Classical supervised training using BigEarthNet data with and without pre-trained ImageNet weights. Experiment 1 Supervised model with various splits of labeled data. For the first set of experiments we used only the “permanently irrigated” label for classification, which is only a small fraction of the dataset at roughly 2.3%. We explore models commonly trained with the ImageNet dataset, and several ResNet models of different sizes, on ever diminishing splits of our labeled dataset.

item.title: Data
item.description: The data for our research are Sentinel-2 multispectral images of earth’s surface reflectance sourced from two archives: BigEarthNet-S2 and Sentinel-2A collection from the Copernicus program. While the former is an annotated dataset that we use for fine-tuning of our models using supervised learning, the latter is an unlabeled dataset we leverage for pre-training. BigEarthNet-S2 BigEarthNet-S2 is a large scale sentinel benchmark archive consisting of 125 Sentinel-2 tiles, atmospherically corrected and divided into 590,326 non-overlapping image patches.
